product_name: Charlotte TilburyTravel Size Magic Water Cream Gel Moisturizer with Niacinamide
summary: SummaryCharlotte Tilbury Magic Water Cream Gel Moisturizer with Niacinamide is a bouncy, weightless, fragrance-free gel water cream that immediately drenches the skin in hydration, refines the look of pores, and visibly reduces redness over time.
details: DetailsBenefitsHydratingNiacinamideGood for: PoresGood for: RednessGood for: DrynessBest for Dry, Combo, Oily, Normal SkinKey IngredientsNiacinamide: Brightens and balances appearance of skin tone and refines the look of pores.Waterlocking Fusion Technology: Traps moisture immediately and retains over time for up to 100 hours of hydration.Biopeptide Complex: Visibly improves skin tone and texture.FeaturesThis moisturizer achieves long-lasting hydration and visibly evens texture and tone for a glowing complexion.Perfect for all skin types, the gel-like formula delivers up to 100 hours of hydration with every application.Never heavy or greasy, it gives a glass-like, dewy skin finish for flawless makeup.Item 2620076How To UseApply to face and neck morning and night after using Glow Toner and Charlotte's Magic Serum Crystal Elixir (both sold separately).For day, finish your routine with Charlotte's Invisible UV Flawless Poreless Primer SPF 50 (sold separately), to protect, hydrate, and prime.For night, finish your routine with Charlotte's Magic Night Cream (sold separately) to visibly firm and plump overnight.IngredientsAqua/Water/Eau, Glycerin, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Squalane, Propanediol, Pentylene Glycol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Glyceryl Glucoside, Niacinamide, Mannitol, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Carbomer, Camellia Oleifera (Camellia) Seed Oil, Rosa Canina Fruit Oil, Caprylyl Glycol, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Sodium Gluconate, Sodium Hydroxide, Tocopherol, Beta-Glucan, Sodium Hyaluronate, Backhousia Citriodora Leaf Extract, Vaccinium Macrocarpon (Cranberry) Fruit Extract, Plumeria Rubra Flower Extract, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Acetyl Tetrapeptide-11, Citric Acid, Acetyl Tetrapeptide-9, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Benzoate.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Apply to face and neck morning and night after using Glow Toner and Charlotte's Magic Serum Crystal Elixir (both sold separately).For day, finish your routine with Charlotte's Invisible UV Flawless Poreless Primer SPF 50 (sold separately), to protect, hydrate, and prime.For night, finish your routine with Charlotte's Magic Night Cream (sold separately) to visibly firm and plump overnight.

reviews.headline: The one moisturizer that has yet to break me out.
reviews.comments: I usually am very sensitive to both moisturizers and primers but this works as both! It's hydrating and a nice light base to put your makeup over.

reviews.headline: I would buy it again.
reviews.comments: Not too long using this product but I really like this moisturizer,  It left my skin feeling hydrated, smooth, fresh and radiant.

reviews.headline: Better than the original!
reviews.comments: Great for combo to oily skin. Gives a glass-like, dewy skin finish. I can wear it with just my tinted SPF and my skin looks great all day.

reviews.headline: Very hydrating
reviews.comments: This moisturizer is genuinely the best and the highest quality i have ever used. I have dry skin with dry patches and while this doesnt get rid of the patches it definitely relieves them the most compared to other products. Better than drunk elephant and better than cerave. The only con is it is soooo expensive. It it honestly worth it to me

reviews.headline: Very hydrating
reviews.comments: This moisturizer is genuinely the best and the highest quality i have ever used. I have dry skin with dry patches and while this doesnt get rid of the patches it definitely relieves them the most compared to other products. Better than drunk elephant and better than cerave. The only con is it is soooo expensive. It it honestly worth it to me

reviews.headline: Great!
reviews.comments: I received this product for free and I loved this product so much! It was so lightweight and hydrating, also leaving me with a total glow! Would highly recommend this product if your looking for a lightweight moisturizer.

reviews.headline: Spectacular and Dewy
reviews.comments: This is the absolute best moisturizer and provides a beautiful glow. The 1.7 oz jar last me 3-4 months and leaves my skin supple.

reviews.headline: Incredible for dry climate
reviews.comments:
This review is 100% honest & true: 
I'm 43, menopause. My skin is desperately dry, withered, wrinkled, lost density, and now acneic. üò´
This cream is sensational. I live in arid dry cold Colorado and this cream is very viscous - like elmers glue! It remains on the skin hours later, sealing in plumping moisture, but NOT occlusive. Great ingredients list, zero fragrance, and wears well under tinted SPF. High shine though - so I use a setting powder over it in some places. Not causing break outs, and lessens the appearance of fine lines.

reviews.headline: Nice
reviews.comments: Glass packaging that in my opinion preserves the product better with excellent ingredients and a texture of a fine cream that absorbs completely into the skin without leaving it oily and contains a soft scent.

reviews.headline: Yes
reviews.comments: I love it let my face rest moisturizer

reviews.headline: It is amazing! Even for little children
reviews.comments: This is rhe perfect not to heavy moisture but not to light! I gave this to my 3 year old and she absolutely loves it! I bought it a week ago and she alresh needs a new one! But im not even mad because it is so amazing! Eveeyone needs to buy this it is so good!

reviews.headline: Irritated skin
reviews.comments: On the first and only try after putting it on,I felt a burning sensation and left my skin irritated.

reviews.headline: This is soooo good
reviews.comments: I have dry skin and currently living in a dry climate as well. Ive tried the normal magic cream and it has vegetable oil, fragrance, just a lot of junk. Especially when my forehead can get closed comedones and breakouts easily. I took a gamble and bought the mini and fell in loveee!!! I am so dry in some areas i often peel, so i was prepared to give this away or return (i cant do gel or gel creams becuase of my dry skin). But i was so shocked at how hydrating this is and it make my skin so shiny and glowy and layers so beautifully under makeup. As a sensitive skin girly too, fragrance free is so important to me as fragrances can be irritating. Also, CT is certified cruelty free by leaping bunny, as a girl who lovess animals and only shops cruelty free, so important! Ive since bought the water cream set with the full size and mini that's on the way and I can't wait! Just try it!

reviews.headline: Charlotte Tilbury Magic Moisturizer
reviews.comments: Didn't absorb. Shiny. Expensive.

reviews.headline: Great product!
reviews.comments: I use the old version and the new one. Both are amazing! It is expensive but its work it. It leaves my face hydrated and a great dewy look

reviews.headline: Glowy
reviews.comments: I received this free from Charlotte Tilbury for my honest review. I have dry, very sensitive skin. When I first put this on my skin was glowing. After a few minutes it started to irritate my skin and I had to wash it off. Sadly this particular product was not for me.

reviews.headline: Love this
reviews.comments: I love all the Charlotte Tilbury productsÔøº. I have the other magic cream and it's amazing. So I was very excited to try this one. I love this magic water cream. It is super soft and doesn't feel sticky.

reviews.headline: Light and cooling moisturizer
reviews.comments: When I use this product it feels refreshing, and cooling on my skin. I love how it's not thick or heavy, yet I notice my dry spots improving. Haven't used long enough to notice a huge difference when it comes to lines/wrinkles, but I would purchase again. I do wish they had a nicer scent though.

reviews.headline: A Nice Treat
reviews.comments: This is such a treat for my skin. It offers hydration without that heavy feel, and it's packed with ingredients like niacinamide and peptides, both important in my routine. Niacinamide is known for smoothing skin texture, brightening, and minimizing pores. The peptides are great for a little boost in elasticity and helps skin stay resilient, which I'm never opposed to. It also has hyaluronic acid and polyglutamic acid, a duo I love because it locks in hydration. I want to note that it's made without oils and is water based, which is a huge bonus if you're like me and tend to get that midday shine. The texture is light but still feels luxurious. It also layers really well under makeup without pilling. This cream is quite spendy, you're looking at about $30 for the travel size. Although I like this cream and its ingredients, there are other moisturizers out there that create the same result but at a more affordable price. If you have some extra money to spend and want to splurge on a luxurious cream, I'd say go for it. In my opinion it's lovely, but not a "must have".

reviews.headline: Amazing cream
reviews.comments: I really like the design of the packaging, it's sleek cute and heavy! I like that the ingredients it has help with oil control, moisture, and reduce the look of pores. The texture goes on even, and does not leave the skin feeling greasy. I have oily skin and this fels light weight!

faceoff_positive.comments:
Okay, so I've been using this new Charlotte Tilbury moisturizer called Magic Water Cream, and it's the real deal. I have dry, sensitive skin, and this stuff is a lifesaver.
At first, I was like, "No way, this is too light," but it's super hydrating. It's like a drink of water for my skin, but without the feeling of greasy residue. I use it with the Magic Serum Crystal Elixir, and my skin feels like a dream. My redness is way down, and my skin texture is smoother than ever. Plus, it doesn't make my T-zone oily, which is a huge win.
I've tried a ton of moisturizers, but this one is the best. It's gentle enough for sensitive skin, but it still provides the hydration my skin needs. And the best part? It doesn't have a strong fragrance, which can be irritating for those of us with sensitive skin.
One thing I really appreciate about Magic Water Cream is that it helps my makeup apply more smoothly. My foundation looks flawless, and my pores appear smaller. I used to struggle with redness and uneven skin tone, but this moisturizer has made a significant difference.
The packaging is also a plus. The glass jar is elegant and feels luxurious, and the lid is easy to twist off and on. While it might not be the most eco-friendly option, it's a small price to pay for such a great product.
I've been using Magic Water Cream for a few weeks now, and I've already noticed a noticeable improvement in my skin. My complexion is brighter, my skin is less reactive, and my overall skin health has improved. I used to wake up with dry, flaky patches, but now my skin feels hydrated and plump.
I've even noticed a reduction in the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles. My skin looks more youthful and radiant. I love how this moisturizer leaves my skin feeling soft and supple all day long.
In addition to the benefits I've already mentioned, Magic Water Cream also offers a few other perks. For example, it's suitable for all skin types, including oily and combination skin. While it's specifically marketed for acne-prone skin,I've found that it doesn't exacerbate my breakouts at all.
Another thing I like about this moisturizer is that it's a little goes a long way. A small amount is all you need to hydrate and nourish your skin. I apply it twice a day, morning and night, and I've noticed that my skin is less sensitive to environmental factors like pollution and temperature changes.
If you're using Magic Water Cream for the first time, I recommend starting with a small amount and gradually increasing it as needed. It's important to listen to your skin and adjust your skincare routine accordingly.
Overall, I'm extremely impressed with Magic Water Cream. It's a high-quality moisturizer that delivers on its promises.If you're looking for a product that will hydrate, soothe, and improve the overall health of your skin, I highly recommend giving it a try.
faceoff_positive.headline: A High Quality Moisturizer For Sensitive Skin

faceoff_negative.comments:
Was excited to try this because I LOVE water and gel moisturizers when they work as promised. Unfortunately when I opened the jar this didn't really look like a water cream and is a thicker consistency that looks only slightly thinner than the OG Magic Cream, so that disappointed me but I still tried it in a few ways. 

I layer a few serums in my skincare routine and during the day I typically can't use more than a water cream otherwise my face is left too oily/dewy. I used this after the Magic Serum and a niacinimide and ceramide serum and typically my skin has a bit of a glow but this left it incredibly shiny/oily looking, almost like the cream has some mica in it. I had to powder my face even after using my mattifying SPF which typically isn't something I need to do. 

I did try this cream on its own and my skin did absorb it better, but it took a solid 30 minutes. I found it worked great under makeup as a first step before primer and my foundation looked great! But for daily skincare needs this doesn't have enough benefits for me to use with nothing else, so I can't really justify the price or plan to purchase this in the future. If you have drier skin this may be helpful for you though.
faceoff_negative.headline: Slightly misleading and doesn't layer well
